1.text: And Jehovah will speak to Moses, saying,

2.text: Speak to the sons of Israel, and they shall take for me an offering: from every man whose heart shall impel him, ye shall take my offerings.

3.text: And this the offering which ye shall take from them; gold, and silver, and brass.

4.text: Cerulean purple, and reddish purple, and double scarlet and fine cotton, and goatsâ€™ hair,

5.text: And skins of rams made red, and tahash skins, and acacia wood;

6.text: Oil for a light, spices for the oil of the anointing, and for the incense of aromatics;

7.text: And stones of onyx, and stones filling up for the ephod and the breastplate.

8.text: And make ye to me a holy place; and I will abide in the midst of you.

9.text: According to all which I having shewn to thee, the pattern of the tent and the pattern of all its vessels; and thus shall ye do.

10.text: And make ye an ark of acacia wood: two cubits and a half its length, a cubit and a half its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height.

11.text: And thou shalt spread pure gold over it, from within and from without thou shalt spread over it; and make to it a wreath of gold round about.

12.text: And thou shalt cast to at four rings of gold, and give upon its four steps: and two rings upon its one side, and two rings upon its second side.

13.text: And make bars of acacia wood, and spread over them gold.

14.text: And bring the bars into the rings upon the sides of the ark, to lift up the ark with them.

15.text: The bars shall be in the rings of the ark: they shall not remove from them.

16.text: And give to the ark the testimony which I shall give to thee.

17.text: And make a cover of pure gold: two cubits and a half its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth;

18.text: And make two cherubs of gold; of turned work shalt thou make them, from the two ends of the cover.

19.text: And make the one cherub from this end, and one cherub from this end: thus of the mercy seat shall ye make the cherubs upon its two ends.

20.text: And the cherubs shall be spreading their wings on high, covering with their wings over the cover; and their faces each to the other; to the cover shall be the faces of the cherubs.

21.text: And give the cover upon the ark from on high; and to the ark thou shalt give the testimony which I shall give to thee.

22.text: And I was known to thee there, and I spake to thee from above the cover, from between the two cherubs which are upon the ark of the testimony, all which I shall command thee to the sons of Israel.

23.text: And make a table of acacia wood; two cubits its length, and a cubit its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height.

24.text: And spread over it pure gold, and make to it a wreath of gold round about.

25.text: And thou shalt make to it a closing a hand breadth round about, and make a wreath of gold to its closing round about.

26.text: And make to it four gold rings, and give the rings upon the four parts which are to its four feet.

27.text: And over against the closings shall be the rings for houses for the bars to lift up the table.

28.text: And make the bars of acacia wood, and spread over them gold, and lift up with them the table.

29.text: And make its dishes, and its censers, and its bowls, and its bowls for libation which to pour into them, pure gold shalt thou make them.

30.text: Give upon the table the bread of the face before me continually.

31.text: And make a candlestick pure gold: turned work shalt thou make the candlestick: its thigh, its shaft, its cups, its chaplets, and flowers, shall be from it.

32.text: And six stems coming out from its sides; three branches of the chandelier from the one side, and three stems of the chandelier from the second side.

33.text: Three bowls made like almonds, in one stem a chaplet and a flower; and three bowls made like almonds in the one stem, a chaplet and a flower: thus to the six stems going forth from the chandelier.

34.text: And in the chandelier, four bowls made like almonds, its chaplets and its flowers.

35.text: And a chaplet under two stems from it, and a chaplet under two stems from it, and a chaplet under two stems from it, to the six stems coming out of the chandelier.

36.text: Their chaplets and their stems shall be from it: all of it one turned work of pure gold.

37.text: And make its seven lights: and raise up its lights to give light over against its face.

38.text: And its tongs and its fire pans, pure gold.

39.text: A talent of pure gold he shall make it, with all these vessels.

40.text: And see, and make in their pattern which thou wert seeing in the mountain.
